plugins.name: Translation Suggestions
plugins.description:
Get translation suggestions for multiple languages while editing text with using a plugin with text review capability.


Translation Suggestions is a plugin with text review capability that automatically launches as soon as you enter text editing mode and shows translation suggestions in the context menu.


Get started:

  1. Run the plugin;
  2. Allow using Translation Suggestions as a text review plugin in the opened modal window (you can also select this from Figma main menu > Text > Text review plugins > Translation Suggestions);
  3. Select the target languages you need;
  4. Close the plugin window.


How to get translation suggestions:

  1. Select any text object and enter edit mode;
  2. Call the context menu by right-clicking on the text highlighted with a blue wavy line to see the suggestions.


Supported objects:

  1. Texts;
  2. Connectors;
  3. Shapes with text (Square, Ellipse, Diamond, etc.);
  4. Sticky notes;
  5. Widgets;
  6. Tables.


Tip:

To quickly search for selected (checked) languages in the plugin UI, you can write check in the search input field.


Translations are by Google Translate engine.


Donation:

You can support the development and maintenance of this plugin by donating via destream.


Creator:

Yury Zeliankouski


My other projects:

  1. Glyphs plugin;
  2. Change Font plugin;
  3. Code Block to File plugin;
  4. Base64 plugin;
  5. Translate widget;
  6. How many Sticky Notes? widget.

plugins.name: SeCo
plugins.description:
SeCo is a simple tool that allows you to quickly find brands & other properties from simpleicons.org.


Features

âœ¨ Import colours & icons from brands, like twitter, facebook, and many more!

âœ¨ Place SVGs without the frame!

âœ¨ Sort items alphabetically or by colour

âœ¨ Quick Search / Auto complete!

âœ¨ Docked Favourites at the top of your list for easy access!


How to use this plugin

Simply search for the icon you're looking for, and click on the tile representing your query. Then you will have the option to populate the icon of your query to your current view, or apply the colour to your selection(s). If you frequent this item a lot, you now have the option to save it to your favourites for next time!


--

If you encounter any bugs or usability issues, feel free to DM me on twitter @ltrademark, or leave a comment below.

plugins.name: Cloneify
plugins.description:
Meet Cloneify, your new design sidekick on Figma.


Designed to simplify your design workflow, Cloneify allows you to clone the style properties from one object and seamlessly apply them to multiple selected objects with just a single click.


How does it work?

  1. Select an object(s)
  2. Run the plugin
  3. Select the desired object you want to clone. Boom!


Say goodbye to the tedious task of manually adjusting each element for style consistency.


Whether you're working on a complex UI project or ensuring uniform branding, Cloneify makes the process quick, efficient, and error-free.


Experience a smoother, faster, and more consistent design process with Cloneify.


Your feedback will help us continue to improve and grow.
plugins.tagline: Copy any design style with a click!

plugins.name: Replace with Instance
plugins.description:
Replace a frame with an instance and copy over the text.


Just select one instance or one component and multiple frames that all share the same layout. Then run the plugin and all frames will be converted to instances. The cool thing is: all texts from the original frame will be copied over to the instance.


Requirement: The instance and the frame should contain the same amount of text-fields.
plugins.tagline: Replace a frame with an instance and copy over the text and its fills.

plugins.name: Magia Record Character Grid Creator Interface
plugins.description:
This plugin is for creating a grid view of your Magical Girls in the game Magia Record: Puella Magi Madoka Magica Side Story (https://magiarecord-en.com/). The game does not include a good overview for displaying all you owned Magical Girls and how awakened and upgraded they are, so this plugin creates that view as image for easy sharing.

Installing the Plugin
1. Duplicate the Figma project (https://www.figma.com/file/jcgWY0YGzPbAwBp47LV3oL/Magia-Record-Character-Grids). 
2. Install the plugin and open the Magia Record Character Grids Project.
3. Right click on the background or go to the hamburger menu and select Plugins > Magia Record Character Grid Creator Interface
4. The HTML window for the plugin will open.

Features
1. Create a fully detailed Character Displays for your Magical Girls, including: Character Card, Stars (Rank), Attribute, Experience Level, Magic Level, Magia Level, and Episode Level.
2. Available values for each field are automatically filled in and available for selection for easy creation.
3. Update an existing Character Display if a mistake was made or as you progress though the game.
4. Copy the properties of an existing Character Display to create a new or update an existing one.
5. Automatic placement of newly created Character Displays with respect to the selected Character Display or parent Frame.
6. Convert copied Character Display frames from one file to another file to work with the new file.
7. Group and Sort Character Displays in a frame based on selected properties.
8. Set Backgrounds for the frames containing Character Displays.

Usage

Create new Character Display
1. Either select an existing instance or frame (can be the document itself)
2. Select the properties you want.
3. Press Create.

Update an Existing Character Display
1. Select an existing instance of a Character Display.
2. Press the Copy and all properties appear in fields.
3. Modify the fields you want to update.
3. Press Update. 

Create new Character Display with Existing Properties
1. Select an existing instance of a Character Display.
2. Press the Copy and all properties appear in fields.
3. Modify any fields if desired.
4. Press Create.

Convert Copied Character Displays from Another File
1. Copy and paste either a Character Display instance(s) or an entire frame containing all the instances to convert from one file to another. Once pasted, all the instances will become frames as they are no longer attached to their master components. All the names of all the layers must match the original components.
2. Select the Character Display frame(s) or parent frame (where all the children are Character Display frames) you want to convert.
3. Press Convert and a toast message will show how many were converted or skipped.
4. All the frames that were copy and pasted over are now converted to instances for which their master components are in the current document. 

Grouping and Sorting List
1. Navigate to the Sorting tab.
2. Select a frame containing only Character Displays.
3. Select the property to group by, the property(s) to sort by, the grouping and sorting direction(s), the direction to sort the ID's (the last property to sort by), and the number of Character Displays per row.
4. Press Sort.

Adding Background to List
1. Navigate to the Background Tab.
2. Select the frame you want to add a background to.
3. Select the Background Type and Background Name you want to add to the frame. You can see the available backgrounds in the Background Page.
4. Press Create/Update.

Resizing Existing Background
1. Navigate to the Background Tab.
2. Select the frame you want to add a background to.
3. Press Resize. You would want to do this if the frame has been resized and the background no longer fits or is no longer centered.

Removing a Background.
1. Navigate to the Background Tab.
2. Select the frame you want to remove a background from.
3. Press Remove.

plugins.name: World Map Generator
plugins.description:
Create beautiful,customized vector world maps without ever leaving Figma!

Explore the globe through a vast library of over 20 geographic projections. Choose from classics like Mercator and Natural Earth, visualize the earth as a sphere with Orthographic, or select unique projections like Bonne, Aitoff, and Winkel Tripel to perfectly match your visual style or data story.


Need a specific viewpoint? For dynamic projections like Orthographic and Stereographic, take full control with intuitive rotation sliders. Effortlessly adjust longitude (Î»), latitude (Ï†), and roll (Î³) to showcase the world from any angle.


Customize the map's appearance with ease. Use simple color pickers to define fill and border colors, and fine-tune the stroke width for crisp, clean lines.


Once your masterpiece is ready, add it directly to your Figma canvas with a single click. Stop hunting for static images â€“ start creating dynamic, publication-ready world maps tailored precisely to your needs. Elevate your designs with geographically accurate and visually compelling maps today!

plugins.name: Smart Cloner
plugins.description:
Make multiple renamed copies of components, frames or other layers in seconds.


â€¢ Choose direction with command and create any amount of copies at a time

â€¢ Completely keyboard accessible: name and create all of the copies in one approach to the keyboard.

â€¢ The part after the last â€œ/â€ is preselected automatically (use cmd/ctrl + a to select all if needed)

â€¢ All copies would be selected and conveniently placed right under the prototype layer

â€¢ Regulate distance between copies. Plugin remembers last value for the next time.


How to use:

1. Select one layer that you want to copy. Works with Components, Frames and other types of layers.

2. Call the plugin. The plugin has 4 different commands for cloning in all 4 directions.

3. Name your copies. Use tab for creating another copy, so you can name all of them in one approach to the keyboard.

4. (Optional) Hit Shift+Tab to focus on Shift input, then type the desired distance between the copies. The plugin will remember that value next time.

4. Hit Enter to create your copies.


Also, visit this thread for video demo: https://twitter.com/aswellasyouare/status/1169334638805958658

plugins.name: GuideGuide
plugins.description:
GuideGuide lets you quickly and easily manipulate guides to speed up layout and create grids, with more power and flexibility than the built in tools.


An annual subscription is required, but you can start a 14 day free trial without signing up. Students and teachers can use GuideGuide for free. GuideGuide is available for most of your favorite design tools and your license unlocks it in all supported apps.


Features:


  1. Create the basics, like margins, columns, rows, and gutters.
  2. Be lazy with quick edge and midpoint guides.
  3. Flex with gutter midpoints or column margins.
  4. Get weird with the Fibonacci sequence and the golden ratio.
  5. Save presets for future use.


History:

plugins.name: Zine Maker
plugins.description:
Create templates to edit zines in page-order and print zines to cut and fold.


You can use this plugin to generate zine templates. Templates will lay out zine spreads in expected page order, with a component for each zine page. Place your content into these components.


Separately, Zine Maker will generate printer page layouts using instances of those components.


Each side of an 8.5x11 printer page contains 4 zine pages, laid out so they print in the correct order. Print double-sided, cut, and fold to create your zine.


Because zines are created double-sided, any increment of zine pages that is not a multiple of 8 will round up so that printer pages are printed correctly.

plugins.name: You Name It
plugins.description:
This plugin is designed to simplify naming in Figma while maintaining consistency across your design projects. The goal is to make it easy to create naming conventions that can be effortlessly applied to your nodes, allowing you to batch rename them in no time. I hope you enjoy using it!


Just start typing: { and you get the list of variables in the UI.


Available Variables:

  • {width} - Replaces with the node's width.
  • {height} - Replaces with the node's height.
  • {layerType} - Replaces with the node's type (e.g., Frame, Rectangle, Text).
  • {layerName} - This placeholder will be replaced with the original name of the node as it is at the time of applying the naming convention. Note that if you apply a new naming convention to a node that has already been renamed with this plugin, {layerName} will refer to the renamed name of the node, not the original name the node had when it was first created. This is because {layerName} captures the name of the node at the moment you press the rename button, whether that name is the node's original name or a name generated by a previous use of the YouNameIT plugin.
  • {index} - Replaces with the index of the current node in the list of linked nodes.
  • {date} - Replaces with the current date in the format YYYY-MM-DD.
  • {alphabet} - Replaces with a letter from the English alphabet (cycles from a-z and then starts over) based on the node's index.
  • {fileName} - Replaces with the Figma file's name.
  • {weekNumber} - Replaces with the current week number.
  • {pageName} - Replaces with the name of the page where the node is located.
  • {sectionName} - Advanced Section Naming Feature: You can now specify particular sections in their naming convention using the {sectionName=number} syntax. For example, {sectionName=1} will replace this placeholder with the name of the first section parent of the node. This allows for more controlled and precise naming based on the node's position in the section hierarchy.
  • Cycling Through Section Names: In cases where {sectionName} is used multiple times but there are fewer parent sections than the number of placeholders, the plugin will cycle back through the section names. This ensures that all {sectionName} placeholders are filled, reusing the names from the closest section down to the furthest.


The legacy version is no longer available.


Happy renaming! ðŸŽ‰


Ps.

If you have any suggestions or encounter any issues, please don't hesitate to get in touch.
plugins.tagline: Effortlessly rename bulk items with variables ðŸ¤™

plugins.name: Fix Frame Numbers
plugins.description:
Rename frames instantly on Figma by removing large numbers from frame labels.


How to use?

Open any Figma file and run the plugin.

Type in any number in the input provided and click 'Run'. The plugin will instantly rename all frame labels with numbers larger than this one.

For example, if 40000 is the input, a frame labelled "Frame 40506" is renamed to "Frame 506".


When to use?

Sometimes, when working across multiple files, a frame with a large number in its label can be accidentally or intentionally pasted into a file. This causes an issue where all frames created subsequently in the file are named with large numbers, causing confusion and annoyance.

For example, a frame labelled "Frame 1000000000" will cause all subsequent frames to have large numbers in their name.

Use this plugin to resolve such issues.


Feedback and comments are much appreciated.
plugins.tagline: Rename frames instantly on Figma by removing large numbers from frame labels

plugins.name: Color Copier
plugins.description:
Simply select any layer with a solid fill and run the plugin to copy its color value.

Supported Formats:
- RGB
- Hex
- HSL
- HSV
Note: Hex color doesn't support transparency. Semi-transparent colors are copied as if they were fully opaque.

Choose which format(s) to copy by opening Preferences from the plugin menu. If you select multiple formats, they'll be on separate lines when you paste the value. Preferences are saved to the file so that you can your collaborators are speaking the same language.

This plugin was is open source: https://github.com/jtini/color-copier. Please feel free to suggest improvements!

plugins.name: ReBo
plugins.description:
ReBo is a simple Figma utility allowing you to precisely place, and organize guides to your frames!


 Features Include...

âœ¨ Easily add mirrored margin bounds to your frames

âœ¨ Create Columns for a quick column (or row) grid

âœ¨ Save your guides for use later

âœ¨ Quick-guide shortcuts to add center margins

âœ¨ Multi-frame guides clear

âœ¨ KeyCombo! Control + Shift + S to save your current guides


Adding guides

By default, your margins are locked, meaning anything you input on a "Left" margin, will mirror the "Right" side. Same is true for Rows with "Top" & "Bottom". Once you've entered your desired values, Make sure you have a Frame selected, then hit Add Guides. That's it!


You can also add columns, and it will respect margins you have placed, if any.


Saving guides

If adding these settings (columns and margins) are part of your normal workflow, you can save these settings by click the â–´ on the bottom right corner or press Control+ Shift + S to bring up the Save Dialog. Give your guides a name, and bam! it should now appear under Saved Guides.


--

If you encounter any bugs or usability issues, feel free to DM me on twitter @ltrademark, or leave a comment below.

plugins.name: Ovvverrrflowww
plugins.description:
Ovvverrrflowww is a dynamic Figma plugin designed to distribute elements randomly within selected frames. Perfect for designers looking to add a touch of randomness and creativity to their layouts, Ovvverrrflowww makes it easy to create unique compositions with minimal effort.


Key Features:


  1. Random Distribution: Scatter elements randomly by adjusting their x and y coordinates, rotation, and stacking order.
  2. Multiple Frames Support: Apply random distribution across one or multiple frames simultaneously.
  3. Customizable Parameters: Configure distribution parameters using the quick actions menu (cmd + p) for precise control over the randomness.


How to Use:


  1. Select Frame(s): Choose a frame or multiple frames containing the elements you want to distribute.
  2. Run the Plugin: Run Ovvverrrflowww to initiate the random distribution process.
  3. Enjoy the Results: Watch as your elements are randomly positioned, rotated, and reordered within the selected frame(s).


Tips:


  1. Quick Actions Menu: Access the quick actions menu (cmd + p) to configure parameters like randomness intensity and rotation range.
  2. Experiment: Try running the plugin multiple times for different distribution patterns. Use opt+cmd+p for quick access.


Unleash your creativity with Ovvverrrflowww and bring a fresh, randomized look to your Figma designs

accepted.name: Sergey Lisovskiy
accepted.description: Designer & frontent developer

plugins.tagline: Distribute objects randomly within the frame

Gemini Image Assistant is a powerful Figma plugin that leverages Google Gemini AI technology to help designers intelligently edit and process images.

Key Features:

Smart Image Editing: Edit and process images through natural language descriptions

Multi-image Composition: Support relationship processing between two images, such as style transfer, element composition, etc.

Instant Preview: Efficient image preloading mechanism, click to preview available images

Multi-round Editing: Support multiple consecutive edits on the same image for fine-tuning effects

How to Use:

Select one or two image layers

Enter a natural language description of your desired editing effect

Get AI-generated images, automatically created next to the original layer

Advantages:

Full support for both Chinese and English interfaces

Intuitive and clean user interface design

Efficient image processing workflow, reducing waiting time

Locally stored API keys for security and reliability

Requires a Gemini API key to use. Suitable for designers, illustrators, and anyone who needs quick creative image processing.

plugins.name: Data Merge
plugins.description:
Need to generate a bunch of certificates or business cards? Do you miss Word's Mail Merge or InDesign's Data Merge in Figma? Want to leverage all the Figma goodness and comfort to create your certificate/business card/anything else's template and don't want to manually duplicate frames and copy and paste all your data?


Data Merge was made exactly for that, just:

  1. create your template
  2. name the layers the same way as the column names of your data (e.g. Name, Surname, Country â€“ each a separate text layer)
  3. copy your data (plugin expects tab-delimited CSV â€” but that's exactly what's in your clipboard when you copy from Google Sheets)
  4. paste it to plugin's UI
  5. hit Create frames
  6. voilÃ , frames with merged data appear âœ¨


ðŸ’¡ Tip: Put things like Name and Surname in an Autolayout to concatenate them

ðŸ’¡ Tip 2: Make your template a component, that way you can still adjust all your generated frames in bulk! âœ¨ (That makes it actually even better than the continuous re-generating InDesign whenever you changed the template hehe) (on the other hand, this plugin doesn't have a templating system yet, it's made for simplicity).


If the plugin helped you or want to motivate me to improve it, you can buy me a coffee â˜•ï¸ðŸ¥°


Notes


Please note this is a total MVP which was originally made to help my colleagues at #HolkyzMarketingu and save their time. Some edge cases might not be cared for, I haven't heavy-tested it on large data sets and so on. On the other hand, the plugin is completely free and forever will be, it has no network access and I really did it because my colleagues needed it and thought it could be useful for other folks, too, nothing else ðŸ¤·â€â™€ï¸


I plan to continuously improve the plugin by polishing its UX, handling edge cases and other things, but my schedule is busy, so can't promise anything. If you want me to though, a supportive comment will be highly appreciated ðŸ«¶


Roadmap ðŸš€

  1. support prefixes (specify that your text layers begin with "#" for example)
  2. rename layers according to specified field
  3. rename layers according to a given expression
  4. better templating system (far in the future)
  5. generate unique QR codes (very far in the future)
  6. you tell me :)

Continuously: better UX (checking CSV on paste, informing user about matched text layers and column names...)



Feedback & Development

Any suggestions and feedback are appreciated ðŸ™ If you're interested or even want to contribute, here's the plugin's repo on GitHub.


Fun fact: this plugin was mostly coded by ChatGPT4, but I did contribute here and there with my dusty coding knowledge, provided some optimisation ideas and was a very annoying product owner to say the least ðŸ‘©â€ðŸ’»

plugins.name: EXAT â€” Pattern Generator
plugins.description:
EXAT

Customize and generate optical illusion grids inspired by mid-century masters.


How to Use

Run the plugin and set the desired parameters. Click the Insert button at the bottom of the Controls panel. EXAT will insert your custom visual on the canvas.


Interface


Controls

  1. Grid Size: Adjusts the number of shapes across the grid, both horizontally and vertically.
  2. Shape Width: Changes the width of each individual shape in the grid.
  3. Shape Height: Changes the height of each individual shape in the grid.
  4. Border Radius: Sets the corner roundness for each shape.
  5. Inner Spacing: Adjusts the spacing between shapes inside the grid.
  6. Outer Spacing: Modifies the margin or space around the grid.
  7. Line Count: Determines the number of lines inside each shape.
  8. Line Spacing: Controls the distance between each line within the shape, affecting how densely the lines are packed.
  9. Min Line Width: Specifies the minimum thickness of lines inside the shapes.
  10. Max Line Width: Specifies the maximum thickness of lines inside the shapes.


Appearance

  1. Line Width Pattern: Controls the variation of line thicknessâ€”options include thinnest lines in the center, on the outer edges, or randomly distributed.
  2. Base Rotation: Sets the initial rotation angle of the lines within each shape.
  3. Rotation Increment: Determines how much each subsequent shape is rotated relative to the previous one.
  4. Rotation Pattern: Specifies the pattern of rotation across the grid, including spiral, alternate, or random rotation.
  5. Background Color: Sets the background color of the grid.
  6. Line Color: Sets the color of the lines inside each shape.

accepted.name: Luka Marr
accepted.description: Design @ MoonPay

plugins.tagline: Customize and generate visual grids and patterns inspired by mid-century masters.

plugins.name: StoryCraft - Design to User Story Converter
plugins.description:
Our plugin converts Figma designs into comprehensive user stories. Streamline your designers' transition to the engineering team with a click.


Instructions

  1. Choose your desired design in Figma.
  2. Use the 'Generate User Story' option in our plugin.
  3. Finally, your design is converted into a user story, which can be copied and paste to your favourite project management tool.


The plugin utilizes GPT-4 Vision, which is currently in the beta version. Sometimes it refuses to generate user stories, but if you try it a second time, it will work.
plugins.tagline: Transforming Figma Designs into Detailed User Stories Instantly.
